p: Annexin A2 (ANXA2) is another member of the family of annexins that has been reported to have roles during viral replication. The incorporation of ANXA2 into IAV particles enhance viral replication, a process facilitated by the conversion of plasminogen to plasmin ( LeBouder et al., 2008). In addition, it was recently reported that the binding of ANXA2 to highly pathogenic H5N1 influenza virus non-structural protein 1 (NS1) enhances viral replication ( Ma et al., 2017).
